alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 25 at 2:30AM PST until February 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 27. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 40 mph expected. * WHERE...San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until 8 AM PST this morning. For the Wind Advisory, from midnight tonight to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing. Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire
